text: This movie is based on a biographical book called "Red Sky in Mourning: A True Story of Love, Loss, and Survival at Sea" by  Tami Oldham Ashcraft. I read this book a few years ago and from that trailer I can see that they did some major changes on the movie adaptation. Most important one: Richard Sharp (Sam Claflin's character) died in real life while the storm was happening and Tami Oldham was the only one of them who survived after 42 days at sea alone. I think they did it on purpose because it would have probably been boring to only see her alone on that boat for the whole movie (maybe he dies later in the movie, I can't be sure), but it's still wrong as it is based on a true story.

text: seriously? she must be hallucinating as implied by his foreshadowing comment in the beginning of the trailer..."after  few days you hallucinate" because if you really dive into the water to "rescue him from that boat--it would be terribly difficult if not impossible to get bak on board. and how would she get him on board and how would he manage to stay close to the boat holding on to the dingy?  All impossible unless she just imagined him there and she "rescued" him in her head. There are several lot at sea movies--the latest with Robert Redford was good but yup unless your Tom Hanks, hard to carry off a movie talking to yourself--she didn't have a volleyball. The japanese guy at least has a buddy until he fed him to the shark! Anyway, I'd see this movie on a rental just to see (if I couldn't find out earlier) what eventually happens since I'm a HUGE fan of the book and admire Tami's courage. Her story is awesome.

text: >>> *ADRIFT (2018)* <<<<<  This Link : https://huit.re/ae1NzeAP  Storyline : Starring Shailene Woodley and Sam Claflin, Adrift is based on the inspiring true story of two free spirits whose chance encounter leads them first to love, and then to the adventure of a lifetime. As the two avid sailors set out on a journey across the ocean, Tami Oldham (Woodley) and Richard Sharp (Claflin) couldn't anticipate they would be sailing directly into one of the most catastrophic hurricanes in recorded history. In the aftermath of the storm, Tami awakens to find Richard badly injured and their boat in ruins. With no hope for rescue, Tami must find the strength and determination to save herself and the only man she has ever loved. Adrift is the unforgettable story about the resilience of the human spirit and the transcendent power of love  Director: Baltasar Korm√°kur  Writers: Tami Ashcraft (book) (as Tami Oldham Ashcraft), Aaron Kandell   Stars: Shailene Woodley, Sam Claflin, Grace Palmer

text: i liked the movie, until the real drama started. Then felt something really odd about the screen play, almost like you see some stupid people in survival scenarios, only to be told all that was not true, quite a twist at the end. Then felt relief from feeling should have been a darwin. But the damage was done, took a lot out of the experience from the movie.  They should have stuck to the original story, instead of the lame make believe. Here is the lesson, please try not to make a fool of the audience. The story was powerful and was completely ruined by the script. Shailene Woodley performance ,as good as it was, simply cannot compensate for the story telling.
